intro: Verbascum alepense, commonly known as the Syrian mullein, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It features tall, hairy stems that can grow up to 2 meters in height, supporting large, velvety leaves that are gray-green in color. The plant produces showy yellow flowers in clusters, typically blooming from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their soothing properties. Verbascum alepense is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
